queries.description: BigQuery dataset is anonymously or publicly accessible
The node image should be Container-Optimized OS(COS)
Kubernetes Clusters must be created with Client Certificate enabled, which means 'master_auth' must have 'client_certificate_config' with the attribute 'issue_client_certificate' equal to true

queries.query_name: Cloud Storage Bucket Is Publicly Accessible
queries.description: Cloud Storage Bucket is anonymously or publicly accessible

queries.query_name: Cloud Storage Bucket Logging Not Enabled
queries.description: Cloud storage bucket with logging not enabled
Object Versioning Not Enabled on Cloud Storage Bucket
Kubernetes Clusters must be configured with labels, which means the attribute 'resource_labels' must be defined
Kubernetes Engine Clusters must have Master Authentication set to enabled, which means the attribute 'master_auth' must have the subattributes 'username' and 'password' defined and not empty
GCP - Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) Basic Authentication must be disabled, which means the username and password provided in the master_auth block must be empty

files.expected_value: Both attribute 'master_auth.username' and 'master_auth.password' are defined and empty
files.actual_value: Attribute 'username' is not empty or attribute 'master_auth' is not empty

queries.description: Kubernetes Engine Clusters must have Legacy Authorization set to disabled, which means the attribute 'enable_legacy_abac' must not be true
Audit Logging Configuration is defective
Kubernetes Clusters must be created with Alias IP ranges enabled, which means the attribut 'ip_allocation_policy' must be defined and, if defined, the attribute 'networking_mode' must be VPC_NATIVE

queries.query_name: KMS Crypto Key is Publicly Accessible
queries.description: KMS Crypto Key should not be publicly accessible. In other words, the KMS Crypto Key policy should not set 'allUsers' or 'allAuthenticatedUsers' in the attribute 'member'/'members'

files.expected_value: KMS crypto key is not publicly accessible
files.actual_value: KMS crypto key is publicly accessible

queries.description: Kubernetes Engine Clusters must have Network Policy enabled, meaning that the attribute 'network_policy.enabled' must be true and the attribute 'addons_config.network_policy_config.disabled' must be false

files.expected_value: Attribute 'network_policy' is defined and Attribute 'addons_config' is defined
files.actual_value: Attribute 'network_policy' is undefined or Attribute 'addons_config' is undefined

files.expected_value: Attribute 'network_policy' is defined and Attribute 'addons_config' is defined
files.actual_value: Attribute 'network_policy' is undefined or Attribute 'addons_config' is undefined

files.expected_value: Attribute 'network_policy' is defined and Attribute 'addons_config' is defined
files.actual_value: Attribute 'network_policy' is undefined or Attribute 'addons_config' is undefined

queries.description: Node 'auto_upgrade' should be enabled for Kubernetes Clusters
Verifies that the OSLogin is enabled
Query to find passwords and secrets in infrastructure code.

files.expected_value: Hardcoded secret key should not appear in source

queries.description: Kubernetes Clusters must have Pod Security Policy controller enabled, which means there must be a 'pod_security_policy_config' with the 'enabled' attribute equal to true

Kubernetes Clusters must be created with Private Clusters enabled, meaning the 'private_cluster_config' must be defined and the attributes 'enable_private_nodes' and 'enable_private_endpoint' must be true

files.expected_value: Attribute 'private_cluster_config' is defined and not null
Attribute 'private_cluster_config' is defined and not null
Attribute 'private_cluster_config' is defined and not null

queries.description: Checks if backup configuration is enabled for all Cloud SQL Database instances

files.expected_value: settings.backup_configuration is defined and not null

queries.query_name: SQL DB Instance Is Publicly Accessible
queries.description: Check if any Cloud SQL instances are publicly accessible.

queries.query_name: SQL DB Instance With SSL Disabled
queries.description: Cloud SQL Database Instance should have SLL enabled
Kubernetes Engine Clusters must have Stackdriver Logging enabled, which means the attribute 'logging_service' must be defined and different from 'none'
Kubernetes Engine Clusters must have Stackdriver Monitoring enabled, which means the attribute 'monitoring_service' must be defined and different than 'none'
Cloud DNS without DNSSEC

queries.query_name: Cloud Storage Anonymous or Publicly Accessible
queries.description: Cloud Storage Buckets must not be anonymously or publicly accessible, which means the attribute 'members' must not possess 'allUsers' or 'allAuthenticatedUsers'
Kubernetes Engine Clusters should not be configured to use the default service account

queries.query_name: Google Compute Network Using Default Firewall Rule
queries.description: Google Compute Network should not use default firewall rule

files.expected_value: 'google_compute_network[positive1]' is not using a default firewall rule
files.actual_value: 'google_compute_network[positive1]' is using a default firewall rule

queries.query_name: Google Compute Network Using Firewall Rule that Allows All Ports
queries.description: Google Compute Network should not use a firewall rule that allows all ports

files.expected_value: 'google_compute_network[positive1]' is not using a firewall rule that allows access to all ports
files.actual_value: 'google_compute_network[positive1]' is using a firewall rule that allows access to all ports

queries.query_name: Google Compute SSL Policy Weak Cipher In Use
queries.description: This query confirms if Google Compute SSL Policy Weak Chyper Suits is Enabled, to do so we need to check if TLS is TLS_1_2, because other version have Weak Chypers
This query checks if logs are enabled for a Google Compute Subnetwork resource.

queries.query_name: Google Container Node Pool Auto Repair Disabled
queries.description: Verifies if Google Container Node Pool Auto Repair is Enabled

queries.query_name: Google Project Auto Create Network Disabled
queries.description: Verifies if the Google Project Auto Create Network is Disabled

queries.query_name: Google Project IAM Binding Service Account has Token Creator or Account User Role
queries.description: Verifies if Google Project IAM Binding Service Account doesn't have an Account User or Token Creator Role associated

queries.query_name: Google Project IAM Member Service Account has Token Creator or Account User Role
queries.description: Verifies if Google Poject IAM Member Service Account doesn't have a Account User or Token Creator associated

files.expected_value: google_project_iam_member[positive1].role is Service Account Token Creator
files.actual_value: google_project_iam_member[positive1].role is not Service Account Token Creator
google_project_iam_member[project].role is not Service Account User

queries.query_name: Google Storage Bucket Level Access Disabled
queries.description: Google Storage Bucket Level Access should be enabled

queries.query_name: High Google KMS Crypto Key Rotation Period
queries.description: Make sure Encryption keys change after 90 days

queries.query_name: KMS Admin and CryptoKey Roles In Use
queries.description: Google Project IAM Policy should not assign a KMS admin role and CryptoKey role to the same member

files.expected_value: google_iam_policy[positive1].policy_data does not assign a KMS admin role and CryptoKey role to the same member
files.actual_value: google_iam_policy[positive1].policy_data assigns a KMS admin role and CryptoKey role to the same member

queries.query_name: OSLogin Is Disabled For VM Instance
queries.description: Check if any VM instance disables OSLogin

queries.query_name: Project-wide SSH Keys Are Enabled In VM Instances
queries.description: VM Instance should block project-wide SSH keys
Check if Google Firewall ingress allows RDP access (port 3389)
Check if Google Firewall allows SSH access (port 22) from the Internet (public CIDR block)

queries.query_name: Serial Ports Are Enabled For VM Instances
queries.description: Check if VM instance enables serial ports
Service account should not have improper privileges like admin, editor, owner, or write roles

files.expected_value: google_project_iam_binding[fail_service].role does not have admin, editor, owner, or write privileges for service account member
files.actual_value: google_project_iam_binding[fail_service].role has admin, editor, owner, or write privilege for service account member

queries.description: Instances must not be configured to use the Default Service Account, that has full access to all Cloud APIs, which means the attribute 'service_account' and its sub attribute 'email' must be defined. Additionally, 'email' must not be empty and must also not be a default Google Compute Engine service account.

queries.query_name: Google Compute Subnetwork with Private Google Access Disabled
queries.description: Google Compute Subnetwork should have 'private_ip_google_access' set to true
As a best practice, it is better to assign an IAM Role to a group than to a user
